SMW Subobject for NormalImage: File:Coal rock.pngObject ID: 11367Uses infobox: SceneryIs members only: falseIs variant of: Coal rock
SMW Subobject for PrifddinasImage: File:Coal rock (Prifddinas).pngObject ID: 36204Uses infobox: SceneryIs members only: trueIs variant of: Coal rock

A coal rock is a rock that contains coal. Players with a Mining level of 30 can mine coal rocks with a pickaxe, granting 50 Mining experience. Coal rocks can be found in numerous mines throughout RuneScape, most abundantly in the Mining Guild.

On rare occasions the rock may give an uncut sapphire, emerald, ruby or diamond.

Coal is used in combination with ores such as iron, mithril, adamantite and runite to smelt bars in a furnace to create metallic armour and weapons with Smithing.

One of the best ways for members to acquire coal is through Motherlode Mine. Alternatively, members could also use an Ardougne cloak and Amulet of glory to get to and from South Ardougne Mine, which has some coal and several iron rocks.

Free players, on the other hand, have access to the Mining Guild (requires 60 Mining), South-west Wilderness mine (in level 9 Wilderness), or Hobgoblin Mine (in level 30-35 Wilderness). All Wilderness locations are dangerous especially going deeper where player killers are always on the prowl, so take necessary precautions, and never bring anything you can't afford losing.

Wearing either mining gloves or expert mining gloves grants a 40% chance for the rock to not deplete upon mining coal, allowing you to mine an additional coal before depleting.

Mining Info[edit | edit source]

Coal rock
Level required 30
Mining XP50 xp
Required toolPickaxe
Respawn time30 seconds

Pre roll drops[edit | edit source]

A gem table rolls before the main drop table.[1] There's a chance to receive nothing here so that players can receive no items from a rock even if they are guaranteed to receive an ore in the main drop table.[2] The table gets more likely to be rolled if the player has a glory amulet equipped: the probability grows from 1/256 to 1/86.[3]

Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
NothingN/A70/32,768; 70/11,008[d 1]N/AN/A
Uncut sapphire132/32,768; 32/11,008[d 1]36315
Uncut emerald116/32,768; 16/11,008[d 1]57030
Uncut ruby18/32,768; 8/11,008[d 1]1,20760
Uncut diamond12/32,768; 2/11,008[d 1]2,742120
  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 1.2 1.3 1.4 The drop rate is increased while wearing an amulet of glory

Main drops[edit | edit source]

The probability for a player to receive some coal depends on the player's mining level. The rock will deplete after receiving the [ore], unless affected by the effect of standard or expert mining gloves.

Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
Coal1Always16727

The chance of successfully mining a coal rock varies from 16/256 at level 1 (if such a thing were possible), up to 100/256 at level 99.[4]

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 11 February 2020. (Archived from the original on 27 November 2020.) Mod Ash: "It adds a gem roll before each ore roll, and if you receive a gem you don't get the ore roll."
  2. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 6 July 2020. (Archived from the original on 27 November 2020.) Mod Ash: "Yes, [the mining gem table has] got [...] chance of giving no gem."
  3. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 7 Feb 2017. (Archived from the original on 18 Jun 2019.) Mod Ash: "[the actual increase when wearing the Amulet of Glory while mining is] 1/86 rather than 1/256 for a gem."
  4. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 21 June 2021. (Archived from the original on 21 June 2021.) Mod Ash: "Coal: 6.3% - 39.2%."
  5. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 14 April 2020. (Archived from the original on 15 April 2019.) Mod Ash: "I believe that's 1/127 from any type of ore. And it looks like the Varrock bonus would give you a second shard roll if you got a second ore."
  6. ↑ Mod Ed. "Mining Guild Expansion." 22 June 2017. (Archived from the original on 15:02, 20 May 2021 (UTC).) Old School Announcements Forums.
